Content: Vanguard Junrock
Tacet Discord - Calamon

Binomial name "Resinacrustidum lapis", member of the Resinacrustidum species. This Tacet Discord is often found active in packs within mines and mountainous areas, along with other Fission Junrocks, relatively low danger level.
The Vanguard Junrock mainly uses melee attacks. Dodging its attacks causes it to rush into the ground and be temporarily immobilized.
Fission Junrock
Tacet Discord - Calamon
Binomial name "Resinacrustidum lapis", part of the Resinacrustidum species. This Tacet Discord is often found active, along with Vanguard Junrocks, relatively low danger level.
Fission Junrock can heal nearby allies, should be dealt with first in battle.
Impulse Predator
Tacet Discord - Calamon

<color=#9656d8>[Electro]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#9656d8>Electro DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Devorsonidum impulsio", Devourer specis. The left upper limb of the Impulse Predators has evolved into a bow and arrow, which can gather conductive energy to shoot at longer distances.
The Impulse Predator shoots a rain of arrows towards its target, dealing DoT Damage within a certain range and duration.
Glacio Predator
Tacet Discord - Calamon

<color=#1891e7>[Glacio]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#1891e7>Glacio DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Devorsonidum glacies", Devourer specis, has evolved a body structure similar to a human "cape", which is presumed to gather condensation energy more quickly to form a "projectile "long-range attack.
After the "javelin" of the Glacio Predator lands, it will explode after a certain period of time, causing unexpected damage to the enemies.
Pneuma Predator
Tacet Discord - Calamon

<color=#46c3d4>[Aero]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#46c3d4>Aero DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Devorsonidum spiritalis", a member of the genus Devorsonidum. The Pneuma Predator's throwing weapon is part of its body structure, and can be recovered using its own pneumatic energy after being thrown.
The throwing weapon of the Pneuma Predator is capable of tracking its enemies. Be careful of its trajectory, otherwise you may suffer serious damage.
Fusion Warrior
Tacet Discord - Calamon

<color=#e15226>[Fusion]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#e15226>Fusion DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Devorsonidum fusio", a member of the genus Devorsonidum. Bilateral upper limbs resemble long and short spears respectively, and can attack by stabbing and chopping. Moderate danger level.

Fusion Warriors can defend and bounce off close range attacks received from the direction they're facing, and will immediately thrust at the enemy if done successfully, however the thrust attack can be parried.
Rupture Warrior
Tacet Discord - Calamon

<color=#7e1f57>[Havoc]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#7e1f57>Havoc DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Devorsonidum ruptura", a member of the genus Disorder. Its appearance resembles that of a human, with a strong desire to attack and a certain degree of danger.
When facing the Rupture Warrior, you need to pay attention to dodging its fast, mid-range dash attack.
Snip Snap
Tacet Discord - Murmur

<color=#e15226>[Fusion]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#e15226>Fusion DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Strepoplasmidum fusio", a member of the genus Strepoplasmidum. Does not possess any intelligence, due of its plier-shape body, occasionally called the "plier beast".

When the Snip Snap is defeated, the residual Thermo energy within the body can trigger a self-destruction, which can be interrupted by a timely attack. Once the self-destruction is successful, it will leave behind a Thermo Energy Circle that deals DoT Damage to players within the circle.
Zig Zag
Tacet Discord - Murmur

<color=#d4bf5f>[Spectra]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#d4bf5f>Spectra DMG</color>.

Scientifically named the "Strepoplasmidum spectrum", a member of the genus Strepoplasmidum. Gained its name due to the lack of intelligence and simple behavioral logic.

When the Zig Zag is defeated, the residual Spectra energy within the body can trigger a self-destruction, which can be interrupted by a timely attack. Once the self-destruction is successful, it will leave behind a Spectra Energy Circle that slows the Resonators within the circle.
Whiff Whoosh
Tacet Discord - Murmur

<color=#46c3d4>[Aero]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#46c3d4>Aero DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Strepoplasmidum spiritalis", a member of the genus Strepoplasmidum. Possesses no intelligence, due to the Aero energy mass gathered in its "head" emitting sound similar to that of a gust of wind, hence the name "Whiff Whoosh".

When the Whiff Whoosh is defeated, the residual Aerodynamic energy within the body can trigger a self-destruction, which can be interrupted by a timely attack. Once the self-destruction is successful, it will leave behind a Storm Eye that continues to attract players to approach and deals Dot Damage to players within the range.
Tic Tac
Tacet Discord - Murmur

<color=#7e1f57>[Havoc]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#7e1f57>Havoc DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Strepoplasmidum ruptura", a member of the genus Strepoplasmidum. Can use Havoc energy in simple ways to attacks, possesses no intelligence.

When the Tic Tac is defeated, the residual Thermo energy within the body can trigger a self-destruction, which can be interrupted by a timely attack. Once the self-destruction is successful, it will leave behind a Dissociation Energy Circle, reducing the Resonance Energy of the Resonator within the circle and dealing DoT damage.
Gulpuff
Mutant Organism

<color=#1891e7>[Glacio]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#1891e7>Glacio DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Tetraodon lateo", a Mutant Organism of the genus Tetraodon.
The Gulpuff can compress the air stored in its airbag and spit out to knock its enemy up, which can deal a great amount of fallen damage.
Chirpuff
Mutant Organism

<color=#46c3d4>[Aero]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#46c3d4>Aero DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Tetraodon spiritalis", a Mutant Organism of the genus Tetraodon. Theorieds suggests it is a relative to the Gurglepuff, but the ecological zones of the two are slightly different.
The Gulpuff can compress the air stored in its airbag and spit out to knock its enemy up, which can deal a great amount of fallen damage.
Glacio Prism
Tacet Discord - Nacrus

<color=#1891e7>[Glacio]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>immunity</color> to <color=#1891e7>Glacio DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Resinacrustidum convenire", a member of the genus Resinacrustidum. One of many low danger level Tacet Discords that are widely found across the world.
Herons are capable of consuming Cluster Prisms of any attribute.
Fusion Prism
Tacet Discord - Nacrus

<color=#e15226>[Fusion]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>immunity</color> to <color=#e15226>Fusion DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Resinacrustidum convenire", a member of the genus Resinacrustidum. One of many low danger level Tacet Discords that are widely found across the world.
Herons are capable of consuming Cluster Prisms of any attribute.
Spectra Prism
Tacet Discord - Nacrus

<color=#d4bf5f>[Spectra]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#d4bf5f>Spectra DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Resinacrustidum convenire", a member of the genus Resinacrustidum. One of many low danger level Tacet Discords that are widely found across the world.
Herons are capable of consuming Cluster Prisms of any attribute.
Havoc Prism
Tacet Discord - Nacrus

It preserves<color=#b49f50>immunity</color> to <color=#7e1f57>Havoc DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Resinacrustidum convenire", a member of the genus Resinacrustidum. One of many low danger level Tacet Discords that are widely found across the world.
Herons are capable of consuming Cluster Prisms of any attribute.
Cruisewing
Mutant Organism

<color=#d4bf5f>[Spectra]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#d4bf5f>Spectra DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Acanthacorydalis squapenna", a member of the genus Resinacrustidum. Commonly found on waterfronts in warm and humid areas throughout Huanglong. Although slightly aggressive, they are easily preyed upon by Geohide Saurians and others, and are not very dangerous. Relatively low danger level.
The Cruisewing can restore HP to its nearby allies at an extremely fast speed. Therefore, it needs to be dealt with first in the battle.
Sabyr Boar
Mutant Organism

Binomial name "Babyrousa fractden", a Mutant Organism the genus Babyrousa. An omnivore Mutant Organism commonly seen everywhere. Although its diet is mainly of vegetative origin, but the temperament is unlike the ordinary herbivores.

The Sabyr Boar's main method of attack is to charge and ram their targets. It will fall to its side and get stunned once hitting an object on the way. If it fails to hit anything, it will flexibly turn around and continue to charge again until it is taken down.
Excarat
Mutant Organism

<color=#7e1f57>[Havoc]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#7e1f57>Havoc DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Myospalax actinoaftia", a Mutant Organism the genus Myospalax. A common small rodent Mutant Organism, mostly found in grasslands or temperate forests and mountains.
When an Excaratte burrows into the ground, use drop attacks to knock it out of the ground.
Lil Geohide Saurian
Mutant Organism

<color=#e15226>[Fusion]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#e15226>Fusion DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Aigialosauridae lapis", a Mutant Organism the genus Aigialosauridae. The lizards have no natural habit of caring for their younglings, thus hatchlings can only survive by imitating the hunting behavior of the adults, scavenging the remains of their food and, if necessary, using other hatchlings as targets for prey.
The immature Geohide Saurian will imitate its mature counterparts. Its fighting style is identical to that of the mature.
Roseshroom (Immature)
Mutant Organism

<color=#7e1f57>[Havoc]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#7e1f57>Havoc DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Agaricus mimetikos", a Mutant Organism the genus Agaricus. In its immatured stage, the Roseshroom does not yet possess the ability to absorb nutrients from Tacetites, thus needing to gather nutrients from nearby matured Roseshrooms in order to survive.
Just like the mature counterpart, the immature Roseshroom's real weakness is hidden inside its Tacetite head. When it is charging, attacking its weakness can disable it.
Exile (Male)
Humans

The name "Exile" bears an unforgivable felony. They can not enter towns, thus left wandering in the wilderness. Although most of the Exiles only paid for their past misdeeds, considering that not all trials in various nations are "fair", there are quite a number who were wrongfully exiled and are rebelling with a sense of fury in mind

Exile Commoners will pick up any weapon at their disposal to engage enemies, but upon taking damage, their weapons will be knocked out of their hands, you can grab these weapons to fight back, but they're quite old, and likely to break mid-fight.
Exile (Female)
Humans

The name "Exile" bears an unforgivable felony. They can not enter towns, thus left wandering in the wilderness. Although most of the Exiles only paid for their past misdeeds, considering that not all trials in various nations are "fair", there are quite a number who were wrongfully exiled and are rebelling with a sense of fury in mind

Exile Commoners will pick up any weapon at their disposal to engage enemies, but upon taking damage, their weapons will be knocked out of their hands, you can grab these weapons to fight back, but they're quite old, and likely to break mid-fight.
Hoochief
Mutant Organism

<color=#46c3d4>[Aero]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#46c3d4>Aero DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Hoolock vexo", a Mutant Organism the genus Hoolock. Hooscamps, though physically incomparable to the more adult Hoochiefs, but the intellectual development has been no different, the Hoochiefs tends to teach Hooscamps to hunt and ambush passers-by in the Dim Forest.
The immature Hoochief learns fighting skills from its mature counterparts. Its fighting style is identical to that of the mature.
Crystal Scorpion
Mutant Organism
The Cyrscorpion is one of the few Mutant Organisms that shares the same common name and scientific classification.
Cyrscorpion will use its pincers to shield itself when dealt with a frontal attack, which is an opportunity to use pistols to strike the Tacetrite core on its back, defeating it more quickly.
Frostbite Tertoise
Mutant Organism

<color=#1891e7>[Glacio]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#1891e7>Glacio DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Chelydra frigidus ", a Mutant Organism the genus Chelydra.
The Frostbite Tortoise will be turned upside down if attacked by plunge attack.
Fusion Dreadmane
Mutant Organism

<color=#e15226>[Fusion]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#e15226>Fusion DMG</color>.

Trinomial name "Chrysocyon brachyurus terreo", a Mutant Organism the subspecies Chrysocyon brachyurus.
Fusion Dreadmanes can cleverly dodge enemy attacks even before they make a move, but it doesn't work every time.
Stonewall Bracer
Tacet Discord - Nacrus
Binomial name "Resinacrustidum lapis", a member of the genus Resinacrustidum.

The Stonewall Bracer will use its left hand to defend. Attacking its defense can break its left hand and force it to change tactics. But once it begins to rage, the broken left hand will be recovered.
Violet-Feathered Heron
Mutant Organism

<color=#9656d8>[Electro]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#9656d8>Electro DMG</color>.

Trinomial name "Ardea purpurea bipenna", a subspecies of Ardea purpurea uniquely found in Huanglong.
Herons regain all of its health after devouring Cluster Prisms of various elements, before entering an empowered state of its corresponding element, dealing more powerful attacks.
Cyan-Feathered Heron
Mutant Organism

<color=#46c3d4>[Aero]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#46c3d4>Aero DMG</color>.

Trinomial name "Ardea purpurea bipenna", a subspecies of Ardea purpurea uniquely found in Huanglong.
Herons regain all of its health after devouring Cluster Prisms of various elements, before entering an empowered state of its corresponding element, dealing more powerful attacks.
Flute Instrumentalist
Tacet Discord - Calamon

<color=#9656d8>[Electro]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#9656d8>Electro DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Devorsonidum impulsio", a member of the genus Devorsonidum.

Though Flute Instrumentalist may the first to flash in front of you, they will not attack you directly. They always play a tune to turn their allies into rage state. If they're under attack, they will teleport immediately to escape.
Tambourine Instrumentalist
Tacet Discord - Calamon

<color=#7e1f57>[Havoc]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#7e1f57>Havoc DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Devorsonidum ruptura", a member of the genus Devorsonidum.
Tambourine Instrumentalists can play a tune to create energy ball of Rapture energy to hinder your actions.
Rocksteady Guardian
Tacet Discord - Calamon

<color=#d4bf5f>[Spectra]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#d4bf5f>Spectra DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Devorsonidum spectrum", a member of the genus Devorsonidum.
The Tacecrux on the chest of the Rocksteady Guardian is its weak point. Use pistols to deal high amounts of damage.
Chasm Guardian
Tacet Discord - Calamon

<color=#7e1f57>[Havoc]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#7e1f57>Havoc DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Devorsonidum ruptura", a member of the genus Devorsonidum.
The Tacecrux on the chest of the Chasm Guardian is its weak point. Use pistols to deal high amounts of damage.
Lil Geohide Saurian
Mutant Organism

<color=#e15226>[Fusion]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#e15226>Fusion DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Aigialosauridae lapis", a Mutant Organism of the genus Aigialosauridae.
Using a pistol to strike the Tacetrite core on the Geohide Saurian's back will cause it to receive a great shock, putting it in a paralyzed state.
Roseshroom (Mature)
Mutant Organism

<color=#7e1f57>[Havoc]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#7e1f57>Havoc DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Agaricus mimicus". Prefers shade and humidity, tend to gather in groups of two or three in west caves rich in Tacetite.
The Roseshroom's real weakness is hidden inside its Tacetite head. Attacking its weakness can disable it.
Rupture Dreadmane Major
Mutant Organism

<color=#7e1f57>[Havoc]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#7e1f57>Havoc DMG</color>.

Trinomial name "Chrysocyon brachyurus terreo". Adult Dreadmanes are larger in size, ambulant and nocturnal, and lives in packs, with strong social and aggressive characteristics.

Havoc Dreadmanes can cleverly dodge enemy attacks even before they make a move, but it doesn't work every time. When endured with enough damage, the Dreadmane enters a enraged state and can encourage its nearby companions with its howl, at the same time, its own attacks will generate additional Havoc infused crystals for long-range attacks.
Hoochief
Mutant Organism

<color=#46c3d4>[Aero]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#46c3d4>Aero DMG</color>.

Binomial name "Hoolock vexo". There are only sightings in the Dim Forest, Mutant Organism with the highest level of intelligence found in Huanglong.

Hoochiefs are usually found in groups, their minors will join along in fights, but they tend to flee and play dead after taking some damage. At this point, if there are adults nearby, you can quickly stop them from fleeing and inspire them to rejoin the fight.
Spearback Ursa
Mutant Organism
Trinomial name "Ursus spelaeus sagispina", mainly found inhabiting the Huanglong Forest. This Mutant Organism has poor eyesight and relies mainly on hearing for hunting.
Spearback Ursa's front paws are covered with Tacetite with extremely strong physical durability.
Chaserazor
Tacet Discord - Artifian

<color=#46c3d4>[Aero]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#46c3d4>Aero DMG</color>.

Part of th artificial species, only found in the Dim Forest. Th Tacet Discord usually uses abandoned vehicles as a host shell, and moves quickly, and once it has set eyes on its prey, it will never give up, hence the name "wind chasing blade scythe". This claim is not very credible, according to the analysis of this equipment, most likely because the prey chased by it fled as fast as the "wind".
The Chaserazor will chase its prey for a long time over vast distances. Therefore, it is advisable to eliminate it at the earliest sighting of its tracks to evade any potential danger.
Exile Leader
Humans

<color=#7e1f57>[Havoc]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#7e1f57>Havoc DMG</color>.

Exile Leaders are mostly Resonators. In the Huanglong region, for example, the Exile Leaders are usually those who have been expelled from the Mornguard for various reasons, and their combat experience and abilities cannot be compared with those of ordinary Exiles.
After taking a certain amount of damage, the Exile Leader will have a significantly increased desire to attack due to pain suffered and anger.
Exile Craftsman
Humans

<color=#d4bf5f>[Spectra]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#d4bf5f>Spectra DMG</color>.

Skilled Exiles who assume the functions of a military officers and mechanics in their respective groups. Their slender appearance was once misunderstood as a lack of combat ability, but those who had this misunderstanding invariably suffered greatly.
The Exile Craftsmans can protect their fellow members with shields and strengthen it further when taking a certain amount of damage.
Fractsidus Executioner
Humans

<color=#7e1f57>[Havoc]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#7e1f57>Havoc DMG</color>.

The Executioner unit takes direct orders from the Fractsidus Leader, all of which are all highly trained Resonators. Executioners who has not perished through countless battles will be given the opportunity to be promoted and even become an candidate to "The Twelve", but from the available information, the chances of this are slim.

Executioners who have suffered some injuries are keenly aware of the dangers on the battlefield and unleashes their true potential - Fades away into the darkness, slowly approaching their prey, and strike.
Legion Hammer
Humans

The abnormal figure of the Legion Hammer is the result of Fractsidus's experiment and transformation. This figure provides them with extremely strong power to wield the hammer or to protect their teammates with their body.
Legion Hammer is not agile. Circle around it to confuse it. But too much circling around will enrage it. It may jump and smash the ground if enraged.
Thunder Squama
Tacet Discord - Calamon

<color=#9656d8>[Electro]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#9656d8>Electro DMG</color>.

The Thunder Squama resembles the fusion of a human and a lizard. It is able to use Wutherons within the Tacet Field for high-speed maneuvers. Initially, it is judged to be the result of the natural evolution of TDs,.

The Thunder Squama will usually test its enemy through constant flash attacks at the beginning of the battle. These attacks can be repelled with Counter-Attacks. A successful Counter will immobilize it. Once it stops probing its foe, it will engage in close range attacks. You can make use of Counter-Attacks to repel its attacks.
Inferno Rider
Tacet Discord - Calamon

<color=#e15226>[Fusion]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#e15226>Fusion DMG</color>.

The usual Tacet Discords does not require a "vehicle" for movement, but the appearance of the Inferno Rider resembles a rider on a motorcycle, presumably this form is derived from a poor imitation of human behavior. The TD's crazy rampage in the "vehicle" is secretly known as "Flames of Fury" by Huanglong.

The Inferno Rider would put its mount's flexibility into good use for charging and rapid slashing. Be careful with its blade attack. If it abandons its ride and gets close to you, you can use Counter Attack to fend its attack.
Impermanence Heron
Mutant Organism

<color=#7e1f57>[Havoc]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#7e1f57>Havoc DMG</color>.

"The Impermanence Heron has three heads" is not an accurate depiction of the beast. Although the nervous system is independent of each other, the "heads" on the left and right sides are similar to the mutant organs that protect the main brain. When the situation is critical, the main "head" will devour them to strengthen its own combat abilities.
Herons are capable of consuming Cluster Prisms of any attribute.
Gleamtender
Tacet Discord - Calamon

<color=#1891e7>[Glacio]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#1891e7>Glacio DMG</color>.

The Gleamtender is a collection of small insect-like TDs called "Glowflies" that are highly sensitive to different sound frequencies. It can determine the location of prey by sound, and can also absorb and imitate their frequency.

This Tacet Discord relies on the ground cocoons to sustain its flight. During flying, it utilizes fluorescent light to locate its target and launch long-range attacks. Destroying the ground cocoons can make it fall to the ground. The Tacecrux at its tail is its weakness, and attacking it can also knock it down from the sky.
Feilian Beringal
Mutant Organism

<color=#46c3d4>[Aero]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#46c3d4>Aero DMG</color>.

Once a tool of amusement for humans, later being hunted and became a nuisance for humans, imprisoned in the forest.
The Feilian Beringal uses the pillar trapping it as its weapon. So the pillar is the threat yet also the weak point. Attacking the pillar may have unexpected result.
Mourning Aix
Tacet Discord - Calamon

<color=#d4bf5f>[Spectra]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#d4bf5f>Spectra DMG</color>.

The Mourning Aix is elegant in form, bearing a bird-like appearance. Originally found in pairs, however, the other aix was defeated by the humans, with its remains forming a "pillar" where the Mourning Aix nests itself.

The Mourning Aix can "grab" the invader with "both hands" and deal a large amount of damage. Launching Counter-Attacks can force the creature to release its grip. Similar to other Tacet Discords, the Tacecrux on its chest is its fatal weakness.
Crownless
Tacet Discord - Threnodian

<color=#7e1f57>[Havoc]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#7e1f57>Havoc DMG</color>.

A copy of the Threnodian "Crownless". It resembles a white-armored knight in appearance, and when risen in power, it extends its blood-red wings, presumably because it briefly manipulates the structure of Wutherons in its body, instantly increasing its mobility and attack power. Recently, it has also been observed that it can produce a body structure that mimics human "weapons".

The Crownless does not immediately engage its opponent at the beginning of the battle. It prefers to test the opponent's strengths and weaknesses. By taking hits, it will gradually figure out the opponent's attack pattern and begin to evade. Once it has fully engaged, most of its attacks can be parried with Counter-Attacks.
Bell-Borne Geochelone
Mutant Organism

<color=#1891e7>[Glacio]</color>
It preserves <color=#b49f50>high RES</color> against <color=#1891e7>Glacio DMG</color>.

The ancient bell on the back of the Geochelone hides its Tacetreite core, which resonates with the core when struck, exploding into a sound wave of Glacio energy.
The shell of the Bell-Borne Geochelone seems indestructible. Only the ancient bell on its back has a few cracks present. Perhaps the key to defeating it lies beneath its bell.
